capital.offerLegalNoticeDescriptionUS: If your application for business credit is denied, you have the right to a written statement of the specific reasons for the denial. To obtain the statement, please contact Adyen's Credit Support Team by emailing %{email} within 60 days from the date you are notified of our decision. We will send you a written statement of reasons for the denial within 30 days of receiving your request for the statement. %{break} The Federal Equal Credit Opportunity Act prohibits creditors from discriminating against credit applicants on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, marital status, age (provided that the applicant has the legal capacity to enter into a binding contract), because all or part of the applicant's income derives from any public assistance program, or because the applicant has in good faith exercised any right under the Consumer Credit Protection Act. The federal agency that administers compliance with this law concerning this creditor is the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC), Customer Assistance Group, PO Box 53570, Houston, TX 77052.
capital.offerLegalNoticeTitleUS: Creditor: Adyen N.V. – San Francisco Branch %{break} 505 Brannan Street, San Francisco, CA 94107.

disputes.accept.disputeDisclaimer: By accepting, you agree that the disputed amount will not be returned to your account.
disputes.accept.requestForInformationAcc: Request for information has been accepted
disputes.accept.requestForInformationDis: Once this request for information is accepted, it will be marked as expired and may lead to a chargeback in the future.
disputes.alert.notDefendable: This chargeback can’t be defended. Contact support for details.
disputes.alert.notDefendedExpired: This request for information wasn’t responded to and was lost by default.
disputes.alert.notDefendedLost: This chargeback wasn’t defended and was lost by default.
disputes.contactSupport.toDefendDispute: Contact support to defend this dispute.
disputes.contactSupport.toDefendRequestF: Contact support to respond to this request for information.
disputes.contactSupport.toResolveNotific: Contact support to resolve this notification of fraud. Refund this payment to avoid a future chargeback and paying extra fees.
disputes.defend.chargebackFeeInformation: A fee is charged for every defended chargeback. We recommend responding only when you have clear and convincing evidence.
disputes.defend.selectDefenseReason: Select the reason you’re defending this chargeback.
disputes.defend.submitSuccessfulInformat: The chargeback details will be reviewed by the scheme, which can take up to 60 days.
disputes.defend.uploadDocumentsInformati: Upload documents that support your dispute defense. Once submitted, no changes can be made.
disputes.defenseDocument.acquirerReprese: The Acquirer Representment Form is an automatically generated document that contains an overview of key dispute details.
disputes.defenseDocument.acquirerRetriev: The Acquirer Retrieval Fulfilment Form is an automatically generated document that contains an overview of key dispute details.
disputes.defenseDocument.additionalTrans: Additional transactions connected with the disputed flight, such as upgrades, excess baggage charges, and in-flight purchases
disputes.defenseDocument.appropriateExpl: An appropriate explanation and documentation showing two separate transactions.
disputes.defenseDocument.autoGeneratedDo: Automatically generated document showing that the retrieval request was fulfilled
disputes.defenseDocument.cardholderAgree: Documentation supporting the claim that the cardholder agreed to a reasonable amount range.
disputes.defenseDocument.cardholderRespo: Documentation to establish the cardholder is responsible for the addendum transaction
Documentation to support that the cardholder is responsible for the disputed amount.
disputes.defenseDocument.cardRecoveryBul: Card Recovery Bulletin or Exception File
Card Recovery Bulletin or Exception File (Help)
disputes.defenseDocument.chargebackRemed: Documentation to support that the chargeback is remedied or invalid.
disputes.defenseDocument.copyOfInvoice: Copy of the invoice or similar document
disputes.defenseDocument.copyOfInvoiceOr: Copy of the invoice, terminal receipt, sales ticket or any other document (Transaction Information Document) that provides the relevant transaction details like transaction amount, delivery address (if applicable) and description of the merchandise.
disputes.defenseDocument.CopyOfSalesDraf: Copy of the invoice, terminal receipt, sales ticket or any other document (transaction information document) that provides the relevant details like transaction amount, delivery address (if applicable) and description of the merchandise
disputes.defenseDocument.copyOfTid: A copy of the TID as proof that the transaction involved a retail sale rather than a credit.
disputes.defenseDocument.coverPageForAme: A cover page that will be sent for Amex disputes
disputes.defenseDocument.creditsOfMilesS: Credits of frequent flyer miles for the flight, showing connection to the cardholder
disputes.defenseDocument.customerWritten: The customer's written confirmation of registration to receive electronic delivery of goods or services.
disputes.defenseDocument.deliveryOfFligh: Proof of delivery of the flight ticket at cardholder's address
disputes.defenseDocument.descriptionOfDi: A description of the dispute reason
disputes.defenseDocument.descriptionOfMe: A description of the merchandise or services. This can be for example the invoice.
disputes.defenseDocument.disclosureAtPoi: Disclosure at the Point of Interaction
disputes.defenseDocument.docAllOfFollowi: A merchant statement documenting all of the following:
disputes.defenseDocument.docCardholderIs: Documentation establishing that the cardholder was issued paper airline tickets.
disputes.defenseDocument.docChargebackCo: Documentation to support that the chargeback code is not applicable
disputes.defenseDocument.docCorrectCurre: Documentation proving the correct currency was provided or specified
disputes.defenseDocument.docIdentifyTran: Documentation that would further identify the transaction
disputes.defenseDocument.docMerchandiseN: Documentation to support the claim that the merchandise was not counterfeit
disputes.defenseDocument.docProvingCardH: Documentation proving the card holder participated in the transacion. This can be:
disputes.defenseDocument.docRemediesChar: Defense Material that remedies the chargeback.
disputes.defenseDocument.docsTwoTransact: Provide copies of two documents (for example terminal receipts or invoices) belonging to two separate transactions with the same shopper.
disputes.defenseDocument.docTermsOfSaleN: Documentation to prove that the terms of sale of the merchandise or services were not misrepresented
disputes.defenseDocument.docTransactionO: Documentation that show that the transaction occurred on an attended POS terminal
disputes.defenseDocument.documentationOf: Documentation of positive AVS response X or Y
disputes.defenseDocument.documentCanBeCr: A document can be a credit due reason.
disputes.defenseDocument.documentCanBePr: A document can be a proof of delivery signature or a proof of receipt copy.
disputes.defenseDocument.documentCanBeSu: A document can be a subscription agreement.
disputes.defenseDocument.documentCanBetU: A document can be a description, item URL, return policy, or a copy of a contract or an affidavit.
disputes.defenseDocument.documentContain: A document containing important shipment data. It should include at least the shipment date.
disputes.defenseDocument.docViaFraudRepo: Documentation that supports the second presentment from the Acquirer’s Loss Data File, the Acquirer Loss Data Report or the Acquirer Transaction Data Report via Fraud Reporter.
disputes.defenseDocument.evidenceCardHol: Compelling Evidence of Card holder Participation
disputes.defenseDocument.evidenceProofin: Compelling evidence proofing the participation of the cardholder in the transaction.
disputes.defenseDocument.evidenceTransac: Description of the goods or services being provided with evidence that the transaction was recurring by providing the start date of the recurring transaction and, if used, an indication that SecureCode or CVC2 has been used on the initial transaction.
disputes.defenseDocument.explanationWhyC: Explanation why the cancellation code is invalid.
disputes.defenseDocument.firstChargeback: Reference number and date of first chargeback
disputes.defenseDocument.flightManifestS: Flight manifest showing the cardholder's name
disputes.defenseDocument.flightTicketWit: Flight Ticket or boarding pass showing the cardholder's name
disputes.defenseDocument.ifDelayedProofS: If the service is delayed, proof showing that the merchant is able to provide the services (for example, documentation showing that the merchant is not out of business)
disputes.defenseDocument.memberMessageTe: Member Message Text sent to the schemes.
disputes.defenseDocument.merchandiseSent: Documentation that shows the merchandise was sent to the AVS-confirmed billing address
disputes.defenseDocument.merchantObtaine: Documentation establishing that the merchant obtained the cardholder's account number, name present on the card, and the confirmation number provided at the time the reservation was made.
disputes.defenseDocument.moreThanOneTran: More than one transaction was processed by providing the date(s) of previous transaction(s).
disputes.defenseDocument.numberAndDateOf: First chargeback reference number and date of original chargeback
disputes.defenseDocument.originalAmountI: The original transaction amount if the disputed transaction represents partial shipment
disputes.defenseDocument.paidByOtherMean: Paid By Other Means Than JCB Card
Paid By Other Means Than JCB Card (Help)
disputes.defenseDocument.passengerIdLink: Passenger identification documentation showing a link to the cardholder
disputes.defenseDocument.proofAirlineTic: Documentation proving that the airline tickets were used by the cardholder or persons that the cardholder authorized.
disputes.defenseDocument.proofCardAndCar: Proof of card presence and cardholder signature
disputes.defenseDocument.proofFlightTook: Documentation proving that the airline rendered the service (the flight took place)
disputes.defenseDocument.proofGoodsServi: Proof showing that the goods or services of the merchant were provided to the card holder
disputes.defenseDocument.proofGoodsWereD: Proof showing that the goods were delivered as described.
disputes.defenseDocument.proofMerchantHa: Proof showing that the merchant had not received a previous chargeback from the cardholder at the time of settlement.
Proof showing that the merchant had not received a previous chargeback from the cardholder at the time of settlement. (This proof is automatically generated.)
disputes.defenseDocument.proofMerchantNo: Proof showing that the merchant or acquirer was not notified of the cancellation at the time of settlement.
disputes.defenseDocument.proofRecurringC: Proof showing that the recurring contract was not cancelled at the time of settlement.
disputes.defenseDocument.proofShowingCar: Proof showing that the cardholder renewed his membership to the service after the cancellation received.
disputes.defenseDocument.proofShowingTra: Proof showing Tracking Info, Tracking Number.
disputes.defenseDocument.proofValidIncre: Proof of Valid Increase of Amount
disputes.defenseDocument.provideRefundId: Provide the refund ID, for the difference in amount.
disputes.defenseDocument.provingTransact: Documentation that supports the second presentment by proving that the transaction resulted from an account takeover. For example: The Acquirer Loss File report, the SAFE Acquirer Transaction Data report or a statement from the authorized cardholder confirming that the account was in fact taken over and that fraud subsequently occurred.
disputes.defenseDocument.reasonForInvali: Reason for the invalidation of the chargeback. Please notice that this reason should be technical from nature, for example: the issuer submitted documentation that failed to support the chargeback.
disputes.defenseDocument.rebuttalGivenTo: Rebuttal or proper disclosure given to the cardholder at the point of interaction.
disputes.defenseDocument.rebuttalStating: Rebuttal stating that the cancellation was never accepted
disputes.defenseDocument.receiptOfFlight: Proof of receipt of the flight ticket at the cardholder's billing address
disputes.defenseDocument.receiptOrOther: A receipt, work order, or other document signed by the customer substantiating that the goods or services were received by the customer.
disputes.defenseDocument.resultsOfMpiCal: Results of MPI lookup service calls.
disputes.defenseDocument.retrievalReques: Proof showing that the retrieval request was fulfilled
disputes.defenseDocument.statementMercha: Statement from the merchant stating that the merchant did not receive the goods.
disputes.defenseDocument.SupplementalDoc: Complimentary information to the sales draft (e.g. Cardholder’s permission for recurring Transaction, MOTO/Electronic Commerce ordering form, Magnetic-stripe phone record.)
disputes.defenseDocument.TEDocumentDetai: Information related to the delivery of the travel and entertainment service (e.g. Hotel guest folio, Signature on file, Car rental agreement, etc.)
disputes.defenseDocument.transactionNotR: Transaction Not Recognized - Contactless and Card Not Presented
Transaction Not Recognized - Contactless and Card Not Presented (Help)
Transaction Not Recognized - Contactless and Card Not Presented
Transaction Not Recognized - Contactless and Card Not Presented (Help)
disputes.defenseDocument.writtenCorrespo: Copies of written correspondence exchanged between the merchant and the customer (such as letter, email, or fax) showing that the customer participated in the transaction.
disputes.defenseDocument.writtenRebutalG: Written rebutal documenting that the goods were repaired or replaced.
disputes.defenseReason.accountNumberNotL: The Account Number was not listed on the Exception File
Account Number has not been on the Exception File with a Pickup Response for a minimum of 60 calendar days.
disputes.defenseReason.acquirerDefendCha: The acquirer can defend the chargeback if the issuer requested it or if friendly-fraud is suspected. This might lead to further escalation with the issuer.
disputes.defenseReason.acquirerProvidesC: The acquirer provides the correct transaction date that is within applicable time limit set forth in section Time Frame for First Presentment.
disputes.defenseReason.addressMerchandis: The merchant can provide documentation that it received a positive Address Verification Service (AVS) response of X (Both the nine-digit Postal zip code as well as the first five numerical characters contained in the address match) or Y (Both the five-digit Postal zip code as well as the first five numerical characters contained in the address match) for the transaction and documentation showing that the address to which the merchandise was sent is the same as the AVS confirmed address.
disputes.defenseReason.authorisationRece: Authorisation was received for the transaction amount or greater from the issuer.
disputes.defenseReason.autoResponseSentT: An automatically generated response has been sent to the issuer. This response was generated just before the Request for Information expires and contains the relevant data present in the system. Please notice that this response may be incomplete (for example if the merchandise description was not provided), which may lead to an invalid response. It is therefore recommended for the merchant to always upload the invoice (or the other requested information) for RFI's.
disputes.defenseReason.autoResponseToRfi: Automatically Generated Response to a Request for Information
disputes.defenseReason.buyerExceededWind: Buyer has exceeded the window to file a return
disputes.defenseReason.cancellationCodeW: The cancellation code was invalid as is shown by the explanation provided.
disputes.defenseReason.cancellationContr: Cancellation Terms of the Contract failed
disputes.defenseReason.cardAndSignatureF: Card was present and a signature exists for a Corporate Fleet Card transaction.
disputes.defenseReason.cardholderAgreedT: The cardholder agreed to an amount range as reasonable, and the transaction amount did not exceed this amount range.
disputes.defenseReason.cardholderBilledF: For example, after the cardholder initially is billed for a vehicle rental, the cardholder is billed for a separate additional amount that represents unpaid parking tickets. The cardholder claims that he or she did not authorize the transaction for the parking tickets. The merchant should provide information about the violations showing that they were issued during the period that the vehicle was rented by the cardholder, as well as the rental agreement with proof of card presence and signature authorizing such charges.
disputes.defenseReason.cardholderCancell: The cardholder cancelled the recurring service, but renewed his membership after the cancellation.
disputes.defenseReason.cardholderDidNotM: The cardholder failed to meet the cancellation terms of the contract.
disputes.defenseReason.cardholderNotifie: The transaction amount was not within the range of amounts preauthorized but the Merchant notified the Cardholder before processing Recurring Transaction
Cardholder was notified but did not reply
disputes.defenseReason.cardholderPartici: The Cardholder Participated in the Transaction
disputes.defenseReason.cardholderRespons: Merchants may remedy the dispute with documentation substantiating the cardholder has participated in the original transaction and documentation to establish the cardholder is responsible for the addendum transaction.

The merchant also must include documentation substantiating that the cardholder is responsible for the disputed amount if the amount represents final audit charges not included in the original hotel/motel or vehicle cardholder billing.
disputes.defenseReason.cardholderShouldH: The cardholder should have returned the goods to the merchant, but the merchant never received these goods.
disputes.defenseReason.cardPresentAndChi: Card was present and Chip was used, but no PIN provided.
disputes.defenseReason.cardWithSignature: Card was present and a signature exists for a transaction that was not processed via the MasterCard Wordlwide Network.
disputes.defenseReason.cbCodeNotApplicab: Chargeback code not applicable (card present transaction)
disputes.defenseReason.chargebackBundlin: Chargeback bundling invalid for this reason code or MCC code
disputes.defenseReason.chargebackCodeNA3: Chargeback code is not applicable because 3D secure was not offered for the original transaction.
disputes.defenseReason.chargebackInvalid: The acquirer determines that the chargeback was invalid the correct transaction amount and currency code were provided.
disputes.defenseReason.chargebackReceive: The chargeback was received after MasterCard's 120 days time limit after the authorisation.
disputes.defenseReason.claimNotJustified: The issuer claims that a previous chargeback indicated the cancellation of the service. This claim is however not justified, since the transaction indicated by the issuer is not chargebacked or was not chargebacked at the time of settlement.
disputes.defenseReason.creditOrCancellat: Credit or Cancellation Policy Properly Disclosed
The merchant can substantiate that the credit or cancellation policy was properly disclosed to the cardholder at the point of interaction.
disputes.defenseReason.de22DontMatchInFa: DE 22 (Point of Service [POS] Entry Mode) of the authorization message and DE 22 (Point of Service Data Code) of the clearing messages do not match in a Face-to-Face transaction.
disputes.defenseReason.defenseReasonIfPr: This defense reason can only be used if there are problems with the quality of the MasterCom scan of the documentation. Do not use this defense reason if the substance of the documentation received shows that the issuer processed an invalid first chargeback. One must use this defense reason when the first chargeback documentation does not correspond to the transaction being charged back (for example, the documentation concerns a different transaction) or when the documentation is incomplete because of a scanning error. For example, the documentation provided is a partial scan with missing information, or it relates to another card or to another transaction.
disputes.defenseReason.delayInSubmitting: The acquirer delayed presentment due to the merchant’s delay in submitting the transaction, as permitted under Chapter 3, Transaction Records of the Transaction Processing Rules, or a national bank holiday of at least four consecutive days prevented the acquirer from receiving the transaction within the applicable seven-calendar-day time frame.
disputes.defenseReason.docToProveNoPayme: Documents (other than Transaction Receipt) to prove that Merchant did not receive payment by other means for the same merchandise or service.
disputes.defenseReason.documentationIncr: The merchant can provide documentation that validates the increased debit to the cardholder's account. For example, documentation showing that the cardholder is responsible for the additional charges applied to his account.
disputes.defenseReason.documentsSentToFu: The supporting documents have been sent to fulfill the retrieval request.
disputes.defenseReason.emvDeviceNonEmvCa: EMV liability shift: EMV device, non-EMV card
disputes.defenseReason.evidenceCardholde: The transaction was a non face-to-face (for example e-commerce) transaction. There is however evidence that the cardholder authorized the transaction.
disputes.defenseReason.evidenceGoodsNotD: There is evidence that the goods or services described on the invoice were delivered as described (not damaged or incomplete). For example, the merchant documents that the cardholder signed acknowledging the goods were received in good condition.
disputes.defenseReason.evidenceServicesP: The merchant can provide additional compelling evidence such as description of the goods or services provided; a receipt, work order or other document acknowledged by the customer that the goods or services were received by the customer; the customer's written confirmation of registration; any written correspondence exchanged between the merchant and the customer (such as letter, email or fax).
disputes.defenseReason.evidenceThatCardh: The merchant can provide compelling evidence to establish that the cardholder participated in the transaction.
disputes.defenseReason.faceToFaceTransac: Face-to-Face Transaction with No Conflicting Information in Authorization and Clearing Message
Face-to-Face Transaction with Conflicting Information in Authorization and Clearing Message
disputes.defenseReason.fallbackDefenseRe: Fallback defense reason code if all other defense reason codes do not apply. Use this reason if there is any documentation available that remedies the chargeback.
disputes.defenseReason.firstChargebackCo: Chargeback code used for the First Chargeback is not applicable to the Transaction.
disputes.defenseReason.firstChargebackDo: The first chargeback does not meet the prerequisites for the dispute reason code. For example, an issuer processes a chargeback for message reason code 4837 (No Cardholder Authorization), with a cardholder letter alleging nonreceipt of merchandise. Since message reason code 4837 does not address issues related to nonreceipt of merchandise, the issuer's first chargeback was invalid, since it does not meet the prerequisites of message reason code 4837, which require the chargeback to include a cardholder letter stating that the transaction was not authorized.
disputes.defenseReason.firstChargebackIn: Information provided by the issuer that is relevant is illegible to the point where it cannot be established that the first chargeback is valid. One must make every attempt to qualify the documentation before using this defense reason.
disputes.defenseReason.formatCbmmddyyArd: The issuer did not provide the information required properly. Expected was the DE72 message text to be in the format CBMMDDYY ARD XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX, where MMDDYY denotes the date and XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX the Acquirer Reference Data of the chargeback containing the documentation to support this chargeback.
disputes.defenseReason.formatMultipleTra: The issuer did not provide the information required properly. Expected was the DE72 message text to be in the format MULTIPLE TRANSACTIONS NNN, where NNN denotes the number of chargebacks to which the supplied documentation applies to.
disputes.defenseReason.formatRpcsMmddyyE: The issuer did not provide the information required properly. Expected was the DE72 message text to be in the format RPCS MMDDYY, where MMDDYY denotes date the account number was listed in the Recurring Payment Cancellation Service (RPCS).
disputes.defenseReason.goodsOrServicesPr: The goods or services were provided
disputes.defenseReason.goodsWereRepaired: The merchant can document that the goods that led to the chargeback, were repaired or replaced.
disputes.defenseReason.intraregionalTran: The acquirer can demonstrate that the intraregional transaction was reported to SAFE as counterfeit fraud and occurred at a hybrid terminal (except for the U.S. region).
disputes.defenseReason.invalidAcquirerRe: Invalid Acquirer Reference Data on chargeback
disputes.defenseReason.invalidChargeback: Invalid chargeback reason code for E-commerce/ POS payment
disputes.defenseReason.invalidReferenceD: Invalid Acquirer Reference Data on chargeback; documentation was provided or not required.
disputes.defenseReason.issuerDidNotInclu: The issuer did not include two sets of acquirer reference numbers (ARNs). Without this information one cannot validate the issuer's claim.
disputes.defenseReason.issuerDidNotProvi: The issuer did not provide the required documentation for this chargeback. This reason can only be chosen between 9 and 45 days of the first chargeback.
disputes.defenseReason.issuerHasInitiate: The acquirer can defend the chargeback if the issuer has initiated too many fraudulent disputes on this PAN eg. more than 35 within the previous 120 calendar days for Visa.
disputes.defenseReason.issuerProcessedCh: Use this defense strategy to remedy situations where the issuer has processed a first chargeback for the same transaction more than once.
disputes.defenseReason.merchandiseWasRec: The merchandise was received by the shopper
disputes.defenseReason.merchantCanProvid: The transaction is recurring, merchant can provide additional compelling evidence such as description of the goods or services provided; a receipt, work order or other document acknowledged by the customer that the goods or services were received by the customer; the customer's written confirmation of registration; any written correspondence exchanged between the merchant and the customer (such as letter, email or fax).

The merchant can provide additional information that would help to identify the transaction. This should include at least a description of the merchandise or services. This could, for example, be an invoice.
disputes.defenseReason.merchantCantRecei: The merchant can not receive this chargeback based on their MCC
disputes.defenseReason.merchantNotNotifi: Merchant was not Notified of Cancellation
disputes.defenseReason.merchantProvidedS: There is proof that the merchant provided the services to the cardholder or person that the cardholder authorized.
disputes.defenseReason.merchantProvideMi: The merchant can provide the documents that were missing or were illegible, causing the chargeback.
disputes.defenseReason.noCreditSlip: No credit slip or other advisement has been given to the card holder
disputes.defenseReason.notAgreeWithRefun: The merchant did not agree with the refund
disputes.defenseReason.notPosTransaction: Transaction was not a POS transaction
disputes.defenseReason.parcelServiceRece: Proof that the cardholder received the merchandise or a person authorized by the cardholder received the merchandise. For example, the card acceptor provided proof of a United Parcel Service (UPS) receipt.
disputes.defenseReason.paypassAmountBelo: The transaction was a PayPass transaction with an amount below the chargeback protection amount.
disputes.defenseReason.pinForOneOrBothTr: A PIN was present for one or both transactions.
disputes.defenseReason.pinUsedToVerifyCa: PIN was used to verify the cardholder's presence in a POS environment.
disputes.defenseReason.posTransactionAnd: The transaction was a POS transaction and a signed terminal receipt is available.
disputes.defenseReason.posTransactionCar: The transaction was a POS transaction and documentation is avaible to proof that the cardholder was present.
disputes.defenseReason.prevChargedbackTw: The issuer previously charged back two or more transactions involving the same MasterCard card account prior to the authorization approval date of the disputed transaction
disputes.defenseReason.previousChargebac: The issuer claims that a previous transaction was chargebacked, cancelling the recurring contract. There is however proof that no prior transaction has been chargebacked at the time of settlement.
disputes.defenseReason.proofCardholderRe: There is proof that the cardholder or person that the cardholder authorized received the merchandise. For example:
disputes.defenseReason.proofDeficiencyCo: The acquirer can document it corrected the deficiency that led to the chargeback.
disputes.defenseReason.proofOfCardPresen: Proof of Card Presence Available (Not authorised via MasterCard Wold Wide Network)
Proof of Card Presence Available (Mastercard Corporate Fleet Card)
disputes.defenseReason.provideInformatio: Provide the required information for collection or fraud case
disputes.defenseReason.provideTransactio: Provide the requested transactional information to the issuer. At least this should include a copy of the invoice, receipt, sales ticket or any other document that provides the relevant order details, like the description of merchandise or services and the shipping data (if applicable).

Provide the requested transactional information to the issuer. At least this should include a copy of the invoice, receipt, sales ticket or any other document that provides the relevant order details, like the passenger name, travel agency (if applicable), ticket number (if applicable) and airline flight information.
disputes.defenseReason.qpsTransactionWit: The transaction was a QPS transaction with a transaction amount equal to or less than the chargeback protection amount.
disputes.defenseReason.receiptWithItemsB: Card was present and a signed terminal receipt is available. The transaction involves loss, theft or damage. The merchant should provide the receipt containing specially the items that were additionally billed, because of the loss, theft or damages.
disputes.defenseReason.reponseToRfiCardP: Response to a Request for Information (Card Present only)
disputes.defenseReason.requiredDocumenta: Non-receipt of Required Documentation to Support Chargeback
disputes.defenseReason.responseToRfiAirl: Response to Request for Information (Airlines only)
disputes.defenseReason.responseToRfiCarR: Response to Request for Information (Car Rental only)
disputes.defenseReason.returnNotAccepted: The cancellation of services or the return of the merchandise was not accepted.
disputes.defenseReason.scanningError: Scanning error - unrelated documents or partial scan
disputes.defenseReason.serviceCancelledB: The service was cancelled, but the merchant and acquirer were not notified in time to prevent the recurring transaction.
disputes.defenseReason.serviceNotCancell: There is evidence that shows that the service was not cancelled at the time of the settlement.
disputes.defenseReason.servicesProvidedA: The merchant has provided services after the cancellation date, which have been used by the cardholder.
disputes.defenseReason.shopperClaimsRefu: The shopper claims that a refund was promised but not executed. To defend against this, simply upload a statement that this was not agreed.
disputes.defenseReason.shopperUsedAirlin: Shopper has or could have used the provided airline ticket
disputes.defenseReason.signedImprintedSa: A signed and imprinted sales slip, invoice, or terminal-generated POS receipt showing that the cardholder, or a person that the cardholder authorized, picked up the merchandise. This documentation proves that the merchant did not ship or deliver the merchandise.
disputes.defenseReason.surchargeCorrectl: The acquirer substantiates that the surcharge was correctly processed.
disputes.defenseReason.surchargeIncorrec: The acquirer substantiates that the pro-rated surcharge was incorrectly calculated by the issuer.
disputes.defenseReason.termsOfSaleWereNo: Terms of sale were not misrepresented
disputes.defenseReason.thisReasonIsTechn: Please take care when using this dispute reason; this reason is technical in nature and does not always address the true nature of the dispute.
disputes.defenseReason.timeBetweenAuthor: The time between the authorisation and the settlement was within the time limits set by the schemes. For normal transactions the time limit is 180 days. In case the card account is no longer active/valid, the settlement should take place within 30 days for normal cards and 6 days for Visa Electron cards.
disputes.defenseReason.transactioAuthori: The transaction was authorised through the Emergency Payment Authorization Service.
disputes.defenseReason.transactionAmount: The credit was previously issued, for example, the merchant already refunded the full transaction amount to the card holder.
disputes.defenseReason.transactionApprov: The transaction approved by the issuer was fully (directory and authentication response both Y) 3D Secure authenticated.
disputes.defenseReason.transactionBetwee: The transaction was between customers that participate in the appropriate Chip Liability Shift Program, occurred at a hybrid terminal, and was initiated with a non-EMV chip card.
disputes.defenseReason.transactionFallsC: The transaction falls under the CVC2 Validation Program
disputes.defenseReason.transactionFromAc: The transaction resulted from an account takeover.
disputes.defenseReason.transactionInform: The Transaction Information Document (TID) shows that the amount was processed correctly
disputes.defenseReason.transactionIssuer: The transaction approved by the issuer was fully (directory and authentication response both Y) 3D Secure authenticated.
disputes.defenseReason.transactionNotCha: The issuer claims that a previous chargeback indicated the cancellation of the service. This claim is however not justified, since the transaction indicated by the issuer is not chargebacked or was not chargebacked at the time of settlement. This can be defended automatically by the system.
disputes.defenseReason.transactionNotFul: The transaction approved by the issuer was not fully 3D Secure authenticated, but there was a liability shift for the given dispute reason.
disputes.defenseReason.transactionNotRec: The transaction was not recurring. For example, if the transaction is an installment.
disputes.defenseReason.transactionSettle: Transaction was settled within Time Limit
disputes.defenseReason.transactionsIniti: Transactions was initiated due to loss, theft or damages
disputes.defenseReason.transactionWasECo: The transaction was a E-Commerce, MOTO or Recurring transaction. The given chargeback reason is not applicable for these transaction types.
disputes.defenseReason.transactionWasInF: The transaction took place in a face-to-face (POS) environment.
disputes.defenseReason.transactionWasPro: The issuer claimed that the transaction was not for an installment billing, and transaction was properly identified as an installment transaction in the authorization request.
disputes.defenseReason.transactionWasRes: The transaction was the result of Guaranteed Reservation Service (a No-Show)
disputes.defenseReason.twoDifferentTidsW: The Merchant can provide documentation to support two separate transactions by providing two different TIDs with the same cardholder account number.
disputes.defenseReason.twoPreviousFraudR: Two or More Previous Fraud-related Chargebacks
disputes.defenseReason.twoSeparateTransa: There is documentation available to support the claim that there were two separate transactions.
disputes.defenseReason.uploadReturnPolic: To defend against this dispute, upload a document that states the return policy, e.g. ToS
disputes.defenseReason.useThisDefenseRea: Use this defense reason if one of the following is applicable:
disputes.defenseReason.validityOfTransac: The merchant can provide an explanation that substantiates the validity of the transaction charged.
disputes.defenseReason.waiverFormAbsolvi: A written merchant rebuttal to the claim of non-receipt of merchandise, such as a waiver form absolving merchant responsibility.
disputes.documentRequirements.acceptable: Max 2MB for PDF or 10MB for JPEG, JPG, TIFF
disputes.documentRequirements.recommende: Recommended A4 or US letter size
disputes.empty.tryDifferentSearchOrCheck: Try different filters or check again later for new chargebacks.
Try different filters or check again later for new disputes.
Try different filters or check again later for new fraud alerts.

disputes.error.weCouldNotLoadYourDispute: We could not load your dispute.
We could not load your disputes.
disputes.error.weCouldNotProcessTheDispu: We couldn't process this dispute. Please try again, or contact support if you continue to have problems.

disputes.inputError.fileIsOverSizeLimitF: File is over %{size} limit for %{type}. Choose a smaller file and try again.
disputes.inputError.somethingWentWrongPl: Something went wrong, please check that your documents are meeting requirements.
disputes.inputError.uploadAtLeastOneSupp: Upload at least one supporting document to continue

transactions.common.types.Capital.descri: Money from an incoming loan grant or outgoing loan repayment
transactions.common.types.Chargeback.des: Money returned to a customer after a disputed transaction
transactions.common.types.Correction.des: Adjustments to your funds, including transaction reversals and deposit corrections
transactions.common.types.Fee.descriptio: Transaction costs and payment method fees
transactions.common.types.Other.descript: Transactions not in another category, usually an adjustment
transactions.common.types.Payment.descri: Money received to your account from a sales transaction
transactions.common.types.Refund.descrip: Money sent back to a customer from a refunded transaction
transactions.common.types.Transfer.descr: Money moved between your account and another account

transactions.details.refund.alerts.notPo: It is not possible to refund this payment. Please contact support.
